review: I literally walked in starving on a Tuesday night after going to Dave and Busters with my friend. I got fries and the Bruschetta Chicken burger!!!! It's soooo good! Literally life changing. The fries also came out hot. It was a blessed day.  On random days, I just crave this burger and I thought I'd share!

Service - Good Wait time - Not a problem Food -  Spinach Artichoke dip - RR has more quantity when compared to Applebees or TGIF. Its really good too. Citrus Harissa Salmon - YUMMMYYYYYYY Swirly Twirly Pasta - My kids love it.

This was my first time eating at Red Robin and it was indeed a great experience. I make a lot of burgers and consider myself unmatched, but they Red Robin stole the show. I ordered an A1 burger and subbed the cheddar for Mozzarella and added sliced pickles and raw onions. That made for a hefty burger accompanied by delicious endless fries. The burger was cooked medium well as requested and was still warm when served. I was tempted to eat another one but the endless fries hit the spot. Fries are the potato fries that look like wedges from Popeyes (unseasoned) except these were baked or cooked hot and very soft.  Although the food was great, the service was more impressionable. I was served by MEGAN. Please do remember that name because it was her service that will ensure I drive back to NJ from NY to eat at this place and the reason you want to head out to this place. Megan makes one mean Margarita! Had 2 and it snuck up on me very quickly (and these were house drinks at $5.50 if memory serves me right). She serves you the way she would want to be served and her consistent follow-up and attention to detail was unmatched (not to mention she was very forward and open to conversation with a smile every time and even shared personal life experience when I made conversation).  Definitely a place I would say the score does not reflect the experience I recently had. My only grief was the fries are small in quantity when they first come out. But, since they're endless I didn't mind. Then again, I'm a person with big a big appetite, it is possible the serving was proportional and I'm just glutinous. Lol.

I came here with my boyfriend on a Sunday. We enter from within the mall, and it looks fairly busy. Here, you have to walk through the entire restaurant to the other entrance in order to be seated by the staff. Weird but okay. We're seated at a booth, and the waiter took our order. We ordered an appetizer and two burgers. We waited about 30-45 min for our food, with our burgers coming out first. I was a bit peeved off by this cause I was hungry. We were about to cancel the appetizer when the waiter apologized and offered the appetizer we ordered on the house. That was okay with us (Hey, free food basically). Burgers were okay (a bit subpar), but the fried were good. Last, we ordered two milkshakes - a mint brownie one and an Oreo cookie crumble one. AND IT WAS THE MOST DISAPPOINTING MILKSHAKE WE'VE EVER HAD. Like, the people in the back didn't even try. The mint brownie one didn't even have brownies in it and didn't taste like mint; it was just food dyed green. The Oreo one tasted like a cup of milk that someone put Hershey's chocolate syrup in and that's it. No oreos whatsoever.  The service from our waiter was excellent with the amount of work he had and the volume of the place during our stay. His name is Anthony Ca. He's probably the only reason I kinda liked being here.  Overall, would not recommend this place to anyone.  Ever.

This is the only Red Robin I've ever been to so I can't compare them to other locations. I first came here soon after they opened and have eaten here like 2-3 times a year. They have an extensive menu with lots of ways to customize your order. They have burgers, salads, and entrees along with appetizers and dessert. There's a full bar with many of their own special drinks with a variety of non alcoholic beverages as well such as milkshakes and flavored lemonades. I've had some of their drinks and never had a bad one. If you're trying to eat healthy they actually have a page in the menu with suggestions such as eating it open faced or "wedgie style" (wrapped in lettuce) if you wanna cut carlories. There's different breads you can ask for and they also have a veggie burger that you can substitute with. All burgers come with unlimited fries that you can substitute with cole slaw or a salad at no additional charge. There's a bunch of other options that I can't recall at the moment. If you're in the area and in the mood for a burger and  the fries your heart desires, I'd say it's worth giving them a try.

I don't think I would ever come to this location again. Unless they hired cooks who actually understand the importance of chicken being thoroughly cooked. My husband ordered boneless wings as an appetizer (see image). Two of the wings were not cooked entirely. My children and I had meals that were cooked thoroughly, but when my husband's entree came out, his food was overly cooked. I feel like the chef was playing a joke on us. A bad one, lol. Manager comped my husband's food, but they need to take the time to train their chef ASAP before someone catches an illness!

Terrible service!!!!  When we walked in my family waited for awhile to be seated.  Then once we already annoyed but really hungry a worker in the back yells "there is a booth back here " so we walk back and get seated in the booth. We pick what we want on the menu but nobody ever comes to our table asking for our orders. Instead all the workers are fighting over which one of them is going to serve us. After waiting for too long my family and the family sitting in the booth next to us decided to leave. We told the workers that this is bad service. Only after we say this is when one of the workers says he will serve if we stay. We said no thanks and left. Too bad because we have been there before and it was good, but we will probably never go back again.
This location is still doing well I feel!!!! Can't complain one bit!!! Last few times I was at this location I say I was served within 20 minutes!!kk

Nothing too memorable about this place. Food was typical of a chain restaurant. I ordered the Black and Blue burger, but it came with no blue cheese on it. It just had blue cheese 'sauce', which was very watered down. The garlic fries looked like someone literally scooped a chunk of minced garlic out of a jar and threw it on top. It was not mixed together at all. The service was good and so was the Guinness, but overall I would rather go to another chain like Applebees.

The blue ribbon burger is why I come here. The crispy onion straws. The chunky blue and that Felipe's juicy beef patty. Ughhhhh deliciousness so worth eating on my cheat day.  I love the hot fresh and crispy fries that come with the campfire sauce. The customer service was excellent and the peach lemonade was refreshing!

The family loves Red Robin. How can you go wrong with great burgers and bottomless fries. Tonight we had the bacon cheeseburger, the Royal Red Robin, which comes topped with an egg and the siracha burger. Everything was delicious. Our server Jess was great.

The burgers here are delicious.  And, the Tavern Burgers are a great deal at $6.99 including unlimited fries.  The fries can be substituted for coleslaw, steamed broccoli, side salad or black beans at no additional charge.  There are many substitutions for an up-charge including mac and cheese, sweet potato fries, onion rings, chili and soup. There are a few places I go to to have a burger on a gluten free bun - Cheeburger Cheeburger, Fridays, Smashburger and here.  The GF buns at Fridays and here are the tastiest.  I like the burgers here and at Smashburger (which is really overpriced).  And Red Robin is the only one of these four to have fries that are genuinely gluten free (they use a dedicated fryer). Plus, the fries are unlimited! For taste and value, if you are looking for a Gluten Free burger and fries, there is just no comparison to Red Robin.  It is the best by far.  If I was still able to eat gluten, this would still be my first choice for a great tasting burger and fries.

If you're in the mood for a delicious burger and some amazing fries there is no better place to stop. Service is spotty...it's the luck of the draw on who your getting but mostly always a good experience and satisfying meal.

We had a 15 minute wait time but were called in sooner, which was good. The wait staff was not great, very delayed and never came over just to ask if we needed anything.  Sweet but sweet doesn't cut it when you want better service.  We had our kids with us and they have tons of mini chalk boards for kids yet they were out of chalk!  The drinks from the bar are reasonably priced and pretty good.  The teriyaki chicken was excellent other than the mushy bun that fell apart.  My husband was not impressed with his Tavern burger and said he wouldn't go back.  The kids burger was great as per my 9 year old but the kids pizza came out cold to the touch for my 6 year old.  It was overall ok but not sure if we will be there again anytime soon.

Came here the first time and it was great. A second and now a third terrible.   I very rarely call out specific employees but the blonde hostess with the short blonde hair needs training, she has no customer service skills.   The waitresses are all pretty nice.   The burgers are like frozen patties and they are just not presented well.  You are better off going to a diner.  The onion rings are so gross they are hard and difficult to bite into.   It's in the mall so it's super convenient especially if you have kids. I've learned tho I'm not going back.  The only thing I like is the fries and my daughter likes the chicken fingers but in all honesty she's never really met a chicken finger she didn't like so I don't know how much that says.
Food is amazing specially the Pub mac & and cheese and the pig out tavern is so damn good specially with that bacon aoili.
Good place, easy in and out there was no wait at all, server was on point. The burger were really good as well as the fries, the best part was the fries are bottomless :)

The worst Red Robin, by far. I'm normally a fan of their burgers, so I have occasionally visited this location. Don't do it. The service is HORRIBLE! For our last visit, we arrived around 11:30AM. There were a couple of tables taken, and the rest of the place was empty. We stood at the mall entrance door, waiting to be seated, as the sign requests...and waited some more. I finally walked into the middle of the restaurant to find the hostess just standing there. I asked "Are you open?", to which I got "Sure, where would you like to sit.". I then walked back to get the rest of my group and we sat ourselves. Eventually a server came over to take our drink orders. She may have gone to the grocery store across town to fill them. She then disappeared for a bit and came back for our food order.  The onion ring tower was actually good, albeit overpriced at almost $1 per onion ring. The burgers were certainly nothing to brag about, and not the masterpieces one would expect after the kitchen took as long as they did to make them. I ordered a Guacamole Bacon burger that came to me with more mayo than Guac. There was a slight spread of what I'm assuming was guacamole holding some shredded lettuce to the top bun. This also came with a whopping 2 slices of the thinnest cut bacon of all time.  The fries tasted like they had been sitting...HOW IS THIS POSSIBLE when they had just opened for the day??? After we ate we paid using the table kiosk. The receipt would not print as they didn't bother to load it with paper. We waited around to get a receipt from the server, but she did not return, so we just left. There are other burger places around, and even better Red Robins to visit. Don't bother with this one.

Service is extremely slow regardless if you eat in, order ahead or at the bar.. burger is always over cooked.. the fries are delicious but limited, hence why they're bottomless since they only give you 7-9 French fries at a time, which may work when dining in. But sucks when you're ordering to go/ take out. Staff is OK, not over friendly but nice enough that I can't/ won't complain.
Good food and drinks, service was great and fast plus you can pretty much order everything and pay on the little tablet they have in the tables. Very good prices too

I've never been to a Red Robin before this visit.  I had heard the ads on the radio and TV before with their familiar jingle, but I always chalked it up to one of those places I'd never get to experience in real life. Not too long ago, a steakhouse in Woodbridge mall closed, and in its place?  A Red Robin.  After passing it for several months, I finally decided to check it out. Red Robin seems to have a fondness for 80's to 90's pop culture.  The walls had tons of retro posters on the wall (including classics like "Back to the Future" and "Indiana Jones").  The tables and booths all have a wood, almost "Hollywood Western" motif.  It's welcoming the way a sports bar is welcoming.  It looks like a place you can just kind of hang out and relax. The service was good, but the young ladies who were running the place have a lot of floor space to cover.  The hostess seemed a tad frazzled when my girlfriend and I entered, but our waitress was very nice and on point.  We were offered refills of our drinks and requests for extra sauces were happily filled after our food arrived. I tried the D.G.B. burger which the menu describes as: "Oven-roasted tomatoes, savory roasted garlic aioli and fresh arugula tossed in citrus olive oil dressing on a toasted ciabatta bun."  The burger was absolutely delicious.  Most, with a roll that my knife cut into without a problem (this burger you see, was a knife and for burger).  The burger had a nice grilled char flavor while the other ingredients offered some brightness into the mix.   We also tried the Tower of Onion Rings.  That is exactly what it sounds like - a tower of onion rings on a giant metal ring.  These were big rings and not uniform like the Burger King ones.  No, these are like the ones you get in a good diner and they were crispy and delicious.  They came with two dipping sauces that were both sweet and savory at the same time.  It was with great effort we did not demolish the entire tower in one sitting. I enjoyed Red Robin, but man, it is greasy food and I can't do it very often!

Went there yesterday for lunch,it was my first visit it won't be my last. I'm reading some new reviews, I have no idea what they didn't like.  The waitress was very attentive,she gave us time to peruse the menu. I ordered the Southern Burger,with candied bacon,caramelized onions,and cheese. The burger came medium rare and off the roll as I requested. It was cooked perfectly. The steak fries were very well seasoned. My friend had grilled chicken,which she was was moist and tasty.  I couldn't believe they give you bottomless fries,or will allow some substitutions. And the bottomless drink refill amazing. I also used the ladies room and was very impressed that it was clean,and they even had 2 sinks one which was lower so a wheelchair bound person could actually use it!! Props to the company for thinking of that(I am handicapped and it was greatly appreciated).
Great food good service and decent prices  Love the bottomless french fries  Good selection of burgers and items  Could do a little bit better with selection of soups

Service was very good however burgers were meh.  One thing I noticed was how dirty the floors and bathrooms were.  Someone needs to run a silent push sweep over the floors and pop into the bathrooms more often.

The worst burger joint I've been to. The Plates were greasy, like they never been washed! But what turned me out the door was that even my beer glass was greasy. The floor manager took a long time to respond and when she finally showed up, it was like she was blind, she couldn't she how dirty the dishes and silverware was. She asked me if I would like to order something else. I said are you kidding and I left.

This was my first time going to Red Robin and I hate their commercials so I was surprised with how happy I was with the food! There are a lot of burger options and I love the endless fries. The service is a little slow, so you'll have to catch your waitress to ask for a fry refill or drink refill. But our waitress was polite and took our orders correctly. Compared to the awful Applebees next store, Red Robin is my favorite place to get quick filling food at the mall! Their alcoholic drinks are very sugary and not too strong, so expect to get a headache!!
We had dinner there on Wednesday and everything was very good! Our waitress was excellent! We will definitely be back soon.

Had an issue a few years ago where a previous manager was extremely rude - I called head management and they were very friendly and apologized for his behavior. I decided to give it another try after a few years. It seems, not surprisingly, the old manager has been replaced. This recent visit the service was friendly, but slow. The service was so slow that the food went cold. This, because it sat waiting to be delivered for 20 minutes, despite the restaurant only being about half full. The new manager firmly warned the wait staff to not let the food sit until it is cold, apologized, and had new food cooked for us. It took about 15 - 20 minutes sitting at the table waiting before we even saw our server. We also sat with empty drinks for about 30 minutes before we asked someone other than our server for drinks. However, that being said, the food is actually very good. The burgers are cooked correctly and as requested, with quality beef. There are some interesting specialty burgers as well. Another benefit it the ability to see into the kitchen. The chefs are high energy and the kitchen looks clean. Overall, I recommend it for a burger restaurant. The food is pretty good and reasonably priced, but make sure you have a lot of time to wait around for your food and drinks.

It was our first time at the red robbin in Woodbridge nj The food and service were  both fantastic  We are looking forward to the red robbin in east brunswick to open soon. It will be much closer to us.  Am sure this will be our Friday night out regular place to eat.

Now I've never been to Red Robin. Until recently I had never lived close to one and never really had much desire to make a trip out of going.  At the same time, I'd consider myself to be a burger guru and the fact that I now work practically across the street from this location made it seem like I should just give in and come here. Sadly, I should've stayed away. We walked in on a rainy Thursday afternoon with barely anyone in the restaurant, yet were told that there would be a short wait. I usually don't mind waiting but I did find this a bit odd. Anyway we were sat within a few minutes. As we were walked to our table, we could make out a view of the onion ring tower sitting on the kitchen counter where the chefs put the orders. I should note that part of our visit revolved around ordering these onion rings.  The menu here is extensive. Tons of burgers to choose from and most of them sound pretty great. Our server, who was also the bartender, came to take our order, only to return just a few minutes later with our onion ring tower, the same onion ring tower that was sitting on the counter when we first walked in! Not only were the rings, not warm, they were completely cold. We flagged down our server who apologized and brought us a fresh batch.  As far as the burger goes, I was disappointed. I ordered the Peppercorn Burger medium rare, which ended up being medium well. The ingredients, which included bacon, peppercorns, cheddar, and onion straws barely made up for tasteless burger. It was just a very uninspired burger. The steak fries (which are bottomless) did prove to be pretty good.  Furthermore, we had to flag down our waitress for drink refills and sauce for my buddy's burger, which he originally ordered. He also ordered sweet potato fries and after asking for another order was served steak fries. Our waitress's only saving grace was that she was nice and apologetic but severely lacking in attentiveness.  With so many strikes, I would've figured that some menu items could've been taken off the bill, especially the onion rings, but no such offer was made. I would say that next time I will complain more, but there won't be a next time anytime soon. I ended up dropping around $20 for lunch, which could've been put to so many, no, any use.  Please save yourself the money, time and calories and stay away.

This location is close to my job so I order over the phone and swing by and pick it up.. I've ordered from there maybe 6 times.. 5 out of the 6 times i've had issues with my order/service.. I've rec'd the wrong order, food undercooked, cold fries.. I could go on but you get the idea.. I was forced to reach out to customer service once because it was so bad.. They apologized & sent me a $20 gift card for the trouble.. i've used the card on 2 different occasions & had issues both times.. the first time they gave me the wrong order.. Today my fries were hot and crunchy on the outside and practically raw on the inside..  When I placed my to go order today, I had to call 3 times to get someone to answer.. When someone did pick up I placed my order and asked for my chicken to be well done.. The response was it's already well done.. Now I've had the chicken before and that is not the case.. So she says If I tell them well done they will burn it.. Do you want your chicken burnt? All I could do is laugh.. I get my food back to the desk and the chicken isn't well done.. Even with the gift card the restaurant isn't worth the trouble.. Even when you complain to the manager of the store you get no response.. Spend your money elsewhere!!

If I could give 0 stars I would, I've never been so frustrated ever in my life over burgers. We were seated within seconds but our server didn't bother showing up for 34 minutes. During this strenuous wait we even got up to request a waiter since tables around us were being served. Finally he arrived, but the food took another 42 minutes.  Ask in terms of our HUGE order it were mere 2 burgers. Desperate of hunger and attention we requested fried and were informed that fresh fries shall be served. Never happened. The food arrives without any apologizes, cold and gross just like everything else. If it wasn't for the manner I have been raised with I wouldn't have even bothered paying them because we had to request 3 servers for a bill. Just for the waiter to finally send a table seater over and instruct us to pay through a "non user friendly" tablet.  If the Manager or staff is reading this kindly find a job for the work you do not the paycheck you take home.
Great service, clean environment, reasonably price...food was good... I definitely plan on returning

Good in general, nice environment. The milk shake is good but a little too thick, the crispy chicken burger is ok. I like the bun, which is very soft, but the crispy chicken is not something I expected, not bad but still prefer the crispy chicken in Mc Donalds.

Worst red robin I went to service was horrible food was lukewarm when it came it. I asked for a double shot of bailey's in the ice cream shake and didn't get it and took 17 minutes for the drink to come out. Not good at all

How can you offer gluten free buns and not even check before it comes to the table. Instead got a wheat bun and had to wait for my 9rder ti be corrected. Also asked for juice for my son, never got it. Awful service....

Recently came here with my best friend. It was a bit frustrating when coming in through the mall because there was no hostess. We had to walk across the restaurant in order to finally be seated. Other than that, the food was absolutely tasteful. Our waitress was so kind and helpful. Another thing I really enjoyed were the tablets they had on the table to order a desert or appetizer, and even pay the bill. Very tech-savy! I plan on coming here 8:10 times i come to the mall, it was just that good.

I came here a few weeks ago for the first time with my best friend after shopping at the mall. I am personally not a huge burger person but I would highly recommend this place to a burger lover or anyone just trying to eat some good food. The waitress was one of the best I've had at any place. The food was delicious and the fries were bottomless. I will be going back the next time I am at the mall.
I think RR is a tad over priced but it's a great location by Woodbridge Mall and the staff is uber sweet.  I usually sit in the bar area to avoid the shopping crowd.

:sigh: I knew what I was getting myself into, but I was really in the mood for a burger on an onion roll.  The hostess sat us right away. The front door is bashed in and has some construction sign. Id love to hear that story.  Sat us at the legit smallest booth ever in the world. Fine. Told our server would be Alexis. I wish it had been, because we got a goon named Chris and it was downhill from there.  He greeted us within 30 seconds, my brother and I hadn't even opened our menus and he was in our faces talking a mile a minute. He joked that he would bring us the onion tower with our drinks. I'm not laughing.  This is a place where they try to memorize your meal as to not write down your order. Reciting it back he had already messed up and didn't even go away yet.  We had been given two napkins and no silverware.  I ran to the bathroom which was DISGUSTING.  Food came quickly and was delivered by a really nice girl. I saw she was someone else's waitress and was jealous. "Chris" was chatting with other staff, breaking glasses, and avoiding our table. I needed a knife and napkins and the nice girl brought it for us.  "Chris" comes speed walking past, tossing a "everything good?" As he kept walking. Sure Chris.  He didn't ask if we needed refills. Ran by a little later and dropped off our check. Sorry we didn't spend a lot of money on our late lunch. Guess he thought he wouldn't be getting a big tip and treated us like crap. I saw him bringing stuff to other tables who had alcohol and appetizers.  Also: the tables never got bussed. We were there for an hour and the same tables had dirty dishes on it. When "Chris" cleared our dishes, he simply put them on the clean table next to us.  I'll make my own burgers. Learned my lesson.

Goooooood burger 100000000 times better than Mc D. ;)   I had barbecue burger with ghost pepper sauce on it and cheesy Fries  Everything was ok till the Indian family who sit right next to us with their child'sssss They ruined every one else's night  Hey But " they were having fun"

I really enjoyed their food. Also the waitress was very friendly and on point. The one thing I appreciated was the waitress did not lie. We asked her about a certain drink and she replied she never tried it - which I really thought was awesome because most places their staff always say "it's great!!" Yet they never tried it out.

Well let me start by saying the place felt like a cafeteria not a restaurant. Ordered a burger with an ice tea. The ice tea should have been called warm tea, I was so thirsty I wanted something cold to quench my thirst but didn't get that. After waiting for like 25 my burger finally came. The meat wasn't hot tasted like it was sitting there waiting to be picked up. The restaurant wasn't packed so I don't know why it took so long . The bread was the main issue. I don't know if the bread was old or that's how it is. How do you eat a burger when the bead falls apart in your hands. Every time I picked up the burger it apart. At one point I ended up with just the burger and toppings on my hands. I was so hungry too.  I noticed the table next to us left a pile of bread and left unhappy saying they had rice and beans at home.  Now to come back again that's not happening again not throwing my money away like that again. I rather eat White Castle burgers than from this place . At least the bread stays together.  I would not recommend this place to friends or strangers.  Their jingle should be " red robin blah". Instead of yum . I forgot I ordered a strawberry lemonade to replace my warm ice tea, how about using fresh strawberries not strawberries from a jar sitting in preservatives. The strawberries looked old and soggy not bright red and firm like a fresh strawberry should look like. Good thing I left and not ordered desert .

After my husband's friend put the idea of Red Robin in his head I knew we were destined to come here.  I was terrified though when I read the other reviews and tried to sway my husband, but it was his birthday and he wanted to go (he is older than 3, lol). We were seated at a booth in the bar area and although the service was a touch on the slower side, the waitress was also the bartender.  She was friendly and tried hard to be where she needed to be.  The food came out exactly as ordered, the waitress even checked back twice to see if we wanted more bottomless fries.  The hamburger and fries were satisfying. I had some kind of specialty ghost burger that was spicy. I really enjoyed it.  Drinks were good.  We tried the blue moon summer tea, interesting and refreshing but 1 was enough.  We both then had a mixed drink for $7 each and they were also good. All in all I think Red Robin is trying to turn things around from these other reviews.
Awful customer service. Size of the burger is too small for the price. And again. Waiters sucks big time

My visit here was fairly pleasant. I dont know what all the jabber is about, but my experience went pretty well. There was really just a bartender on my side, was pretty dead so she was doing the server part too, so props to her for that.  Great selections on the menu and i was surprised on how good the blue moon shake was. I dont know of a place that does this. Def was good. The burger (whiskey river) and onion ring tower was on point. Thank you for that. I shall return to get another experience

As part of a chain, I didn't find this Red Robin location different than their other locations. I go for the unique burgers and bottomless fries. It's nice that you can get a lettuce wrap in place of a bun for the gluten-free people. I find the service and cleanliness of the restaurant to be average. One nice touch are the touch screen devices on the table. It makes splitting the bill convenient.

Great experience at red Robbins. A little wait time, we walked in at 1:37 and left at 2:54pm. Way to long --- we heard one of the waitresses say that a lot of people called out. Other than that, the food was good - we had the onion tower and I also had the royal Robbins burger - tastes as good as it looks. Bathroom needs a little more cleaning. But good experience over all food wise.
Horrendously slow service with very few customers.  Come on people...at 545 on a week night this place should be better prepared for customers

Service is super slow, food not up to standards with the rest of the red robin system. Probably will not be returning to this location unless they drastically change! Waited over 10 minutes for a refill on my beverage.
This is the most dry Hamburg I have ever had I will never go to a Red Robin again My first time and the last if I was you stay away and save your money

Came here with my boyfriend since we were hungry. It was empty and quiet maybe only two tables. We walked in and got seated immediately. The server took our drink order and came back about 10 mins later to take our order. Our food came out pretty slow. The table behind us that had just came in got their food before us and we came in first. It took some time for our food to come out.  Me and my boyfriend got a burger with fries. It was delicious. But according to my boyfriend everything here sucks besides the burgers. Server didn't even come check up on us all she did was stand there with the bunch of employees that didn't do anything but talk among each other. Took us awhile to get our check which sucks ! Would I come back here ? I think not

Went there recently for lunch. I ordered the soup and sandwich deal, French Onion and the BBQ Chicken Wrap. The soup came out missing the main ingredient, ONIONS! It was sent back and honestly when it came out with the onions it wasn't much better. Our waitress was very friendly though.

AVOID AT ALL COST. Most pathetic service. No one took the order for over 30 minutes. After all the wait the fries and burger came cold. Waited for over 10 mins to pay the bill. The system on the table to pay bills is not at all user friendly or intutive.

This red robin has recently gotten new management and David Gonzalez is terrific!! They went above and beyond to make our lunch quick and painless with our toddler. We tried the new "cro-nuts"...one word...AMAZING! we'll be back! Thanks!

Service was awful here. First we had to find someone to seat us then it took about 10-15min before we even had a menu to look at.  If it wasnt so late and we werent so hungry we would have left. Fortunately the food was good so it wasnt a total loss. Hopefully other locations are better....but never again to this one.

Awful service.  Worst Red Robin ever! Place is dead, servers all over but no one around to help, take order, or even get our drinks! Horrible!  Tip is: if you do dare to come here, make sure you ask for the check as soon as you sit down.
Service was very good Burgers were well prepared and endless fries kept coming.  I would definitely come again

I will never eat hear again. The first time I ate hear it was very good. However, the second time I went was absolutely the worst restaurant experience I have ever have I ordered an appizer and they charges me for it and never brought it I ordered a hamburger and ordered it meduim rare and it came out tasting burned and rubbery once I paid and left the resturant I got sick and started vomiting in the parking lot then had diarrhea the next 2 days I will never waste my money at a discusting establishment like this again.

HORRIBLE!! Last 2 times I came here was the worst ever! 1st time - we were seated & while waiting for a server to greet us & take drink orders, servers have no customer service cursing behind my table while ringing in their guests' orders. After 15 minutes of not having anyone greet my fiancé & I, I had a server get a manager for me. Some indian manager came to our table & hesitated to take drink orders, after 10 minutes, no drinks reached my table. A young server came to my table & apologized & decided to take our drink orders AFTER WE ALREADY TOLD A MANAGER!!! It was a complete mess & management doesn't know how to run a business. 2nd time -- The food came out cold & wrong. My server was busy & never came to my table so I had a older server get a manager for me. It looked like a kitchen manager came to the table & my party noticed how disgusting underneath his nails were (being that he looked like he was kitchen manager, that would be a health code violation of some sort) the manager was very nervous & didn't know how to handle our issue so he brought out my order AGAIN since it came out wrong & it STILL CAME OUT WRONG AGAIN! He also comp'd our whole bill. I'm just really upset with this place & don't recommend it to anyone. I deff wont be coming here anymore! P.s - the wraps are disgusting & everything slides right out, it's all a mess & disgusting!

I went there for dinner yesterday with my two children. We went at about 5pm before the dinner rush. The place seemed to be maybe 20% full at most. There were empty tables everywhere. We entered into the area to wait to be seated and no one greeted us. We waited for quite a while. I had never been there so my daughter said she thinks we were supposed to seat ourselves. I grabbed 3 menus and we found a table. We waited again quite a while and were told we needed to go up front and wait to be seated. We left and walked the mall a bit but returned about a half hour later to try again. I guess that waiting part soured my expectations slightly. I just thought the food was just OK. For one adult and two children with no appetizers the bill with tip was over $50. I had no appetizers a blue cheese burger and a lemonade. My daughter had a blue cheese burger and a small milkshake. My son ordered off the children menu and got a milkshake and mac and cheese. The portions were VERY small. My son ate his mac and cheese in about 30 seconds. It was about half a coffee cup full of mac and cheese and some mandarin oranges. I ate my burger very quickly and had the tiniest bit of French fries. Maybe 8 medium sized fries in a small cylinder. I thought the sign said unlimited fries but I was never offered any more and only saw my waiter once when he brought the food. You pay yourself with some computer thing on the table. It wasn't terrible food but I thought it was a poor value and poor customer service. It wasn't any kind of dining experience and I would NOT recommend it to a family. For under $50 I could have easily just went to McDonalds.

I love Red Robin - they have an allergy menu. Everyone should have one of these, it takes the guess work out of ordering meals. Most times when you ask about a particular ingredient in your food, you get an answer that isn't confident followed by a "you probably shouldn't order it". It can be very frustrating. Well, here, they have your special menu that you order from and they serve your food separately from the rest of the tables and call it the allergy order - which is a little weird, but hey, at least i am fairly confident that it isn't going to kill me.  The food was good, the service was good, everything's good!

First of all,this place has poorly trained staff all around, from servers to bartenders. At times, I couldn't tell how many bartenders there were, if any at all. There was no one in site!  Second of all, let me state that as a bartender in a busy restaurant myself, staff should be expected to serve and bartend in tandem! NOT TO MENTION, this place was not even busy at this time! My friends and I wanted to just sit at the bar, have a drink and grab a quick snack while watching football. Let me tell you what a major fail this ended up being. We sat down and weren't greeted at all for about 10 min and then finally a bartender came around to get us a drink. We ordered the Irish beer milkshake or something like that. It took about another 15-20 min to make and serve it. ( I don't think you should be making these kinds of drinks if they're gonna take that long to make )  After being served our drinks, all we wanted to order were fries, which took about 30 to 45 min to arrive. That's a poor effort on whomever is running the kitchen. Poor kitchen management for sure.  Whilst I was sitting at the bar, I only noticed one bartender taking orders and working the service bar. There was another girl doing just about nothing to help the other bartender out. She sat at a table and watched the other bartender work countless amounts of tickets. Finally, the only competent bartender became  frustrated enough to speak up. And here's the real kicker, the girl comes up to the service window and says ..." I can't do this, I'm about to just throw these tickets out I can't deal with these milk shakes and drinks, this is crazy" Ummm hello !!! You're a bartender in a busy restaurant, you have to work the window once in a while. Get up off your bottom and help out your fellow bartender.  Now, I was ok with the bartender until we asked to pay using three cards. We asked for the check and she never gave it to us! After 15 minutes, we asked again to split it and she goes, "Oh come on, really?!?!" That was unexpected and not how you want to treat your guests. We should feel free to pay any way we want. So I ended up paying the whole bill and tipping her 20% because I felt bad that she was working all alone.  In conclusion... Get your ish together and work on hospitality! Also, it would be nice to scrub down the restaurant-- it was gross with flies everywhere! My advice- have more than one or two bartenders working. I don't know how this place runs with their bartenders as is. Also, management needs to step there ish up as well, be more attentive to your failing bar and poor servers.  Red robin, Woodbridge mall, run the other way!

I went to Red Robin for the first time tonight and I have to say I love this place. It's very similar to Buffalo Wild Wings. I did encounter some minor issues during my visit, but my server and the manager were nice enough to take some items off our bill because of it. Otherwise, my food was excellent. If you want a good place to get a burger, Red Robin is the place to go.

I have to say - I've been to this location twice now and have yet to experience any of the issues that are frequently mentioned. In fact, I waited until the second visit before writing a review because I had seen so many negative reviews after the first visit. No issues as of 2 visits! The first time I went with a couple of friends. We had a waiter named Jonathan. He was pleasant, checked on us often, refilled the drinks frequently and just did an overall great job of keeping us happy. The second time was just earlier today with my fiance (had to get a dress for an event tomorrow and figured why not grab a bite). Our waitress was Cynthia (I believe...I know it was either Cynthia or Claudia...pretty sure Cynthia). She was just as good as Jonathan. Both times, there were no issues with the food at all - it came out quickly, it was cooked correctly and it tasted wonderful! I'm completely in love with their freshly cooked kettle chips and hummus - yum, yum! On our way out, the manager offered a friendly smile and asked if everything was to our satisfaction. We were happy to respond that it most certainly was. We've most definitely found a new favorite spot!

I will never recommend if attempt to come into this location. First nobody greeted us. The hostess looked at us and looked away. We asked another employee for how long the wait would be and whom was helping to sit customers? Her reply, "Give the hostess a moment she's alone and she's pregnant". I'm sorry that sounds personal. You shouldn't be working on your feet all day then. If this is how a business is ran.... Good luck to this location. Instead we took our business right next door to Applebee's and got seated in 7 minutes. By the way we WAITED 15 Minutes and nobody acknowledged us at Red Robin. Got one star because the location actually looked nice and tidy.

THE FOOD IS GREAT WHEN THEY GET IT RIGHT!!! I live 2 miles from wdbg center and was very happy when i hear red robin was coming i have been to this one 6 times and all 6 times the VERY COMPENSATING manager has had to give me my food for a discount cause these fools cant get it right!! i order a double with no onions or tomatos i get a single with EXTRA ONIONS AND TOMATOS!!!

Red Robin at Woodbridge Mall? DON'T. DO. IT. The service absolutely TERRIBLE! Cons first because... not even the pros could outshadow the cons! Cons: *Despite having tons of seating, there was STILL a wait with TONS of empty sections with TONS of servers just hanging out. What the... *The wait times are different at the entrance from the mall vs. the entrance from the outside. Doesn't make any sense even with their iPad text service. *Our server was a nice girl, poorly trained, but nice girl.  I bet at the end of the night she hoped that she was punked with the way serving us went. *Soup came out burnt - don't know how that happened.  We asked for a manager to tell him so we returned and it got taken off our check.  He apologized over burnt soup. (It'll come in 5 mins)... 30 mins go by... (i'm so sorry.. it'll just be a few seconds) Called the manager, he apologized but REALLY NOW... 45 mins go by and our food comes out piping hot.  Oh okay.. it took us not one but two complaints about your establishment for our food to come out. Pros: *Cute bar area *Tons of seating *It's adjacent to the mall! *The manager came over at the end of our mean and offered us his 50% off "Family discount." DESPITE ALL OF THE COMPLAINTS (which btw thank you Red Robin corporate for getting in contact with me and sending me $20 GC to come eat at your restaurant again - which I will choose to eat at a different location), I'd pick Red Robin as the last place to eat.  The whole experience left a sour taste in my mouth. It shouldn't have come down to us complaining a numerous amount of times.  Had they known they would be so backed up, why not offer us a free appetizer or just SOMETHING?! I'd give zero stars... but Yelp won't let me. - Why, Yelp, Why!

I had high hopes going into this new location of Red Robin, as I love burgers and even better bottomless steak fries!  But that quickly fleeted as the service here is terrible.  Maybe its due to the fact that it's a new location but that's not an excuse for properly training your staff, of which are clueless teenie boppers (not that there's anything wrong with that).  The service is extremely slow and inattentive. Mistake 1 - Telling me I had to finish my fries before I received more, even though my burger arrived with barely any fries to begin with.  Don't argue with a customer, just do it!  And then the server fails to bring them altogether!   Mistake 2 - Not getting the manager when asked by a customer and instead telling your friends to look busy. It's a shame because the burgers are good! I'll give you another shot though Red Robin!

I drove almost an hour away to try this place  . I went at 6:00 place wasnt crowded at all (thou it was a monday night). Our waitress margarita was awsome. She definetly appeared to be the best working at the time.   Very attenative bu not over bearing. Tried the whisky bbq burger and it was delicious. Fries are nothing special but the fact there unlimted makes the $10 burger a better deal. All n all i really enjoyed the place and will be back to eat there again.

THOMAS IS THE WORST EFFING SERVER! Table was dirty when we were seated, does not have a grasp of a basic higher level vocabulary. Spilled my drink, didn't even get me napkins, pretty rude, really spacey.

Red Robin has changed so much since I first started going; I love how many options they give you for toppings, sides, buns, and protein choice. Surprisingly enough, this is a perfect place for vegetarians (they have both Morningstar and Boca Vegan patties!). This location is brand new, very clean, and huuuge. Tons of seating and very open considering there are two entrances (one from the street, the other from inside the mall). Sweet, accommodating service. They also have a system where they put your phone number into an automated waiting list and text you when your table is ready. Pretty neat! Most of all I really enjoyed my meal; I ordered the Veggie--Morningstar patty with grilled zucchini, caramelized onions, tomatoes, and a balsamic cream sauce. I also asked for it bunless, instead opting for a lettuce wrap. What a great choice! They cut the lettuce so it basically forms a ginormous bun around your patty. While it's completely impossible to eat unless you have the mouth of a giant, it's easy to peel away and craft the size you like. The modification went perfect with my veggie burger as well.  I don't frequent chain restaurants often, but I definitely wouldn't mind coming here again.

Good food... Not so good service. The first time I went, we waited 30 min after we put in the order.  Was about to walk out when manager apologized. Gave us a new waitress and the food came out 15 min later.  We gave RR a second try months later. A little better,  but they forgot to give us any silverware or napkins. Forgot the dip for the carrots. We had a very nice waitress though.

Came here after shopping on a Sunday, was mid-afternoon so not very busy. There was a sign up saying that since there's 2 entrances to go to the bar area to get seated. Waited by the bar area with about 5 other people, nobody was seated. Saw people at the other entrance getting seated, walked back to the other side, nobody was getting seated there anymore. Waited another 10 min before leaving. Nobody acknowledged our presence at any point.
1:45 minutes waited for food.  The only thing we kept getting were promises it would be out in a few minutes.  We like many other patrons walked out hungry.  Clearly a very poorly managed restaurant.

We decided to give this place another chance. As usual, we were disappointed. At least we didn't have to eat to get to that point. We asked in and asked for a table, but we're told it's a 35 minute wait. Sad thing is, the restaurant was half empty, literally. I asked why the wait since the restaurant was half empty, and we're told the kitchen is understaffed and running behind on orders. Really? I guess we are going to Applebee's instead. Last time for Red Robin's!

A group of us came to this brand new Red Robin after my fiance got an offer to go for their "soft opening"/"training" dinner. Basically, they offerred a free appetizer for the table and free entrees so their cooks and servers could get the opportunity to train and prepare. It was a pretty cool experience getting to go for this, plus it gives me a chance to be the first person to review them on Yelp! Upon seating, we looked around and liked the vibe in the place. Our waitress came over promptly and took our drink orders (had to pay for these, but no big deal). She did a good job with this, got a few drink descriptions mixed up, but gotta expect some sort of learning curve. Our drinks did also take a while to come out, but they were also fairly busy so we'll let it pass. At first I got the Blue Moon pumpkin (yes, they already started their Octoberfest line!), and the glass had brown sugar on the rim! The drink was great, and much needed for the end of the week. We also got one free smoothie/shake for the table, which my fiance took advantage of (got some fruity drink that I thought tasted like a mix between pepto and robitussin). We got the chips with salsa and guacamole, which was great and came out timely (the chips were even hot). For dinner, I was torn between a few different options, but ended up getting the Royal Red Robin, a burger topped with bacon, lettuce tomatoe, cheese, and a fried egg. My few critiques on this, it wasn't really medium, the bacon wasn't crispy enough, and it was lacking a sauce. The latter issue was fixed by asking for chipotle mayo, but the others I'll let slide again since they are still training (hey, it was a free meal so I can't complain much. If not, I would have made this a lot lower stars...). The fries were great though and definitely on point with their signature seasoning mix. All in all, everyone enjoyed their meal, and in the end, we were very pleased to see our $75 bill come down to almost nothing! They do have a little work to do to get up to par with other gourmet burger joints, so in the future if I have to pay for a meal here I'll expect a better burger. Our server did a good job to, though a little more personality would have been nice as well...

Wanted something to eat after shopping in the Mall. Was hesitant about coming here after having a bad experience in the one on Staten Island, but I figured I would try it again. When we got there,  the place was more than half empty. After ordering our food, it took a good 30-40 minutes for out food to come out. My wife ordered some sort of chicken salad which was soggy with dressing. I ordered a well done cheese burger which was medium rare. Ate it any way as I didn't have all day to wait for another one to come out. The only good thing was the fries. I would definitely not go to a Red Robin again

We ate here a few weeks ago for my first ever visit to red robin. We went on a weekend afternoon during a sort of off time, like 3 in the afternoon. It wasn't very busy, so it was nice and quiet for a weekend afternoon. I asked the waitress lots of questions and she very happy to help. She checked in a few times. The gluten free bun was delicious and the turkey burger was cooked perfectly. I would definitely come back here for a burger and some of those delicious fries.

We went at 8:15 on a Saturday Night and told a 35 minute wait and the dining room was empty. There were 2 hostesses who said "we have a 35 minute wait. I know we look empty but the other dining room is full. Then they said sorry and turned around and walked away."  Even if we wanted to wait they acted like they didn't want us to eat there. We left and went to Johnny Rockets instead.
The burgers are pretty good and the service is okay but I can say that I do enjoy the bottomless fries and the desserts are good

So we went there during lunch hours... Restaurant was half full .. We got seated immediately ...  The burger  I ordered was AWESOME !!  but my wife's grilled chicken was not completely cooked ... The server apologized and replaced the dish ..  My only cribs would be that it takes them long to bring your food ( its a damn burger joint .. how long does it take to make a burger !!) .. and at least at the time we went ..the restaurant looked understaffed ..!!  Overall OK experience!!

I'm from Seattle and grew up eating Red Robins. I was so excited when this new location opened up in NJ not far from me but our first experience at this location was terrible. On a Saturday evening for dinner there was no wait, we were seated immediately. Which was a good sign since my hungry 4 year old was with us but it took forever to put an order in and get our food. My husband ordered a burger, my daughter chicken fingers, and myself a salad. Our meal literally took 1 hour after placing an order to get to our table. The manager was very apologetic about it and comp'ed half of our meal but that doesn't make up for the slow kitchen service. The table next to us even got a frozen jalapeno in their salad.

I don't live in NJ anymore, but if I did, I'd never come back here. I've eaten here about three times. Food has been pretty good each time. My problem is with their horrible service.  The last two times I ate here I called in to order my food to go about twenty minutes before arriving to the restaurant. When I show up to pick up my burger and salad, the restaurant was completely chaotic. It took a few minutes to be acknowleged but eventually the person in charge of takeout looks at the order sitting on the counter, checks the ticket, and tells me that it isn't mine and to wait a few more minutes for my food to be ready. So I sit and wait. 20 minutes go by, meanwhile other people are picking up their orders and leaving, getting seated to eat, and having drinks while I wait for my take out that I now ordered more than 40 minutes ago...... Growing more and more impatient and hungry, I ask the waitress where my food is. She looks at the ticket of the SAME bag that has been sitting there this whole time, and says "oh this is yours." ARE YOU FREAKING KIDDING ME?? What the hell were you reading before when you didn't realize it was my burger 20 minutes ago? To make things even worse, this exact same scenario has happened not just ONCE, but AGAIN when I decided to give them another try and order again a few months later.  Apparently whoever they've hired to work the bar/take out counter can't frickin read. If I didn't have some sense I would have cursed them out for making me sit there and wait for nothing, but if you can't say something nice don't say anything at all!
Sitting in the waiting area for an hour after being told it's a 15 min wait. Half of tables are unused yet the wait is ridiculously long for a burger. Burger better b worth it!

We had a much better experience this time around.  The restaurant was clean,  servers were friendly abd the food was hot and delicious.  I don't know what they did but it was a pleasant surprise abd an impressive turn around.

I usually don't have a problem with this place but on my last visit, I had the worst experience ever eating out. I was told there was a 35 minute wait although the place was pretty much empty. When i come back after the wait, the floor is covered in grease and the restaurant is clearly understaffed as I see waitresses bussing tables. The service was terrible and we had to ask multiple times for silverware and "clean" dishes. The manager ended up bringing the silverware and she did not seem like she knew what she was doing at all. All in all, just an awful experience. Never going back there again.

I had been introduced to Red Robin maybe 3 years ago, at the location in Clifton. Place was great and I fell in love with the Bleu Ribbon Burger.  Well, after moving back down to Central NJ, and not having my delicious love of a burger in quite some time, I was excited for the opening of the Woodbridge location. However, my excitement was met with only disappointment. Just about every time I've been there, my order has been messed up, the kitchen is out of something, or the service just downright sucks. I have two noteworthy experiences to share. I came to this location maybe 2 months ago to the day with my girlfriend and my father. After being seated, we had to wait about 20 minutes before even being asked for our drink orders. I didn't mind at first, it looked like they were understaffed, and I knew how that could be having worked in a restaurant/bar for over a year.  When our drinks came back, we attempted to order. I wanted to order their Bleu Ribbon burger, however the kitchen was out of bleu cheese. I figured, what the hell, I'll take the opportunity to try something new, so I ordered the bacon-guacomole burger instead. But, oh hey, they were out of guacomole as well. I settled for a regular bacon cheeseburger, as did my girlfriend. She specifically requested no lettuce or tomato, as she is allergic to the latter.  Well, about half an hour passes before we see our server again, drinks had been completely empty for about 10. The food comes out and lo-and-behold, there's tomatoes on her burger. She made the complaint, and the burger came back looking like things had just been scraped off.  At this point I was extremely frustrated so I confronted the manager. She was shocked and took many of the items off of our bill, as well as gave us a gift card. She was very courteous and understanding. Next More recently, this past Monday, I met a few friends here for happy hour. We sat in the bar area. No food involved this time, I was pretty distraught from my last experience. We put in our beer orders, while there were 2 other people in this area. Bartender was taking a while so I looked over to the taps, and there's our beers just sitting there. They sat there for 15 minutes. My beer tasted flat by the time it got to me, so I complained, and she went to refill it. She filled it with the wrong order. Took 3 tries to get a simple beer order correct, friends food came out cold and we were largely ignored for service. Do yourself a favor and go to a different location if you want Red Robin. I wont be returning until they restaff or make improvements. .

Just opened a few months ago. Great Experience. fast courteous and freindly service, food was great, it came out fast, and always had a full glass. The manager and waitress was sure to stop at the table to ee how everything was and was quite nice.  The burgers were cooked perfect the the fries actuall came out HOT!!!

Waitress was good however changes to the menu and food were poor. They no longer offer the quesadilla which is very sad all appetizers are now the same thing you will find at every other restaurant, chips and some form of dip, or wings. We got wings as an appetizer and they were dripping in grease. I ordered the Guacamole burger as always with fries extra extra well done. The burger was soooo greasy with maybe a teaspoon of guacamole on it and no bacon (which it is supposed to have), fries were literally cold. My boyfriend ordered chicken fingers with fried shrimp and his was also cold. How odd. Never going back to red robin unless I am forced to by someone who is paying for my meal. What a disappointment (and it was my birthday ugh)

This place was absolutely horrid. I could see into the kitchen from where I was sitting, well, I could see the cooks at least... Those of which who had beards and dread locks swinging around while preparing food. Yuck. Nice hairstyles and all but there should be a rule against that kinda stuff. The place wasnt packed which should have been our first sign. Our waitress was good at first.  We ordered the pretzel bites & beer cheese as an app. EW. My boyfriend said "it tastes like they fried them yesterday and microwaved them just now." Then we got burgers for our entree of course. My boyfriends burger was $14!!! And it didn't come prepared how he wanted it or how it was presented on the menu! Mine was burnt and I was totally turned off at this point. Then when we wanted our check, we got it...  If we paid is another topic. Our waitress kept passing the table and not picking up our card. That night I woke up out of a wonderful night sleep to puke in the garbage can next to my bed. Never going to a Red Robin again. 0 stars.

Our first round if drinks took forever as well as the appetizer. The waiter was nice in chatting us up to make us feel better but the entrees took just as long to come out. If you're in a hurry go somewhere else. If you're willing to wait it's a pretty good eat.
This locations is bad but I've been to others that were very good. The food was cold and they didn't cater to the customers well.

Very disgusted with this place.  Our server did not hesitate to tell us that it was supposed to be his day off and that someone called out (as if the customer really cares that you, the worker, are inconvenienced by having to be at your job). He really seemed out of it as he took each of our orders (party of 6). Even when I ordered my mother's drink while she was away (a simple water), he gave me a hard time about getting it because he wanted to wait for her to be back for her to order the same thing. I mean really? Our waiter did not even bother to check in on us after taking our orders no less.  Not only did our appetizer come out cold (spinach & artichoke dip), but ALL of our dinner orders came out cold (burgers, sandwiches, fries, everything), with one of our orders being completely wrong. All after waiting over an hour for our food. This is unacceptable, especially since the place hardly seemed understaffed and that there weren't too many customers there to begin with.  We let our inconvenienced waiter know of this and he gave us a hard time about getting the manager, who was more interested in counting her change than helping the customers. Eventually we got our waiter to track her down, and she did apologize profusely as did the waiter, but still this level of service and incompetence is unacceptable for any establishment. Fortunately it was 'on the house', but all six of us left hungry and very dissatisfied, as none of us ate our undercooked food.  Needs a complete rehaul. Needs tougher management that know how to run a restaurant and definitely needs to retrain the waitstaff, all who seem to be a bunch of teenagers/college kids who care more about socializing with one another than to run a business.   Totally unacceptable, I will never return to this establishment.

(-) 40 mins to get food for 3 people (-) 2 burgers cold, 1 lukewarm. no burgers had pink although we all asked for it. (-) i got a completely different burger than i ordered. didn't even feel like reordering for the right one. All three times i've been here the service has been terrible, the wait was over 40 mins for my food, it was only three burgers and a grilled cheese.

If I could give this place a negative star I would.  The service and food were terrible.  We arrived at 8pm on Saturday night and were greeted warmly at the door and seated right away.  Things quickly went downhill from there.  We had a pretty simple order and the food took almost 45 minutes to arrive even though the place was not that busy.  My soup arrived cold and my husband's soup arrived after the entrees (and only then because we had to remind the waiter he had ordered soup).  I specifically asked for my salad dressing on the side.  The salad arrived with no dressing on the side and when I got it and poured it on my salad, I realized there WAS another dressing already buried at the bottom of the salad.  The combination of the two dressings was completely disgusting.  My son ordered riblets and received a plate with several CLEAN BONES and I do mean CLEAN as in NO meat on them at all.  While waiting for my family to finish, I ordered coffee, which came with no cream or sugar.  When I requested cream, I was told they were out of it. Over all a horrible experience and I will NEVER return to this place again.

My husband and I visited this location on 10/6/12 & will NEVER go back. It was approx. 12:30 p.m. & the restaurant was only about 1/4 full of customers. It took nearly 10 minutes to be greeted at the door, the host brought us to a table & a waitress walking by told the host "that's a closed section" but the host left us there anyway & asked the server to do the table. Once the waitress gave us menus we ordered an onion ring appetizer & two drinks right away. Our burgers were so burnt they were almost on the same level of a hockey puck. We both took only one bite, no one even asked us why we didn't touch our food. Thanks again for a 61 dollar meal that I did not get anything out of. Oh and the onion rings were over done.

I came for their soft opening, having already been to another nearby Red Robin location previously in the past. Red Robin is delicious! They have a large variety of burgers, and their fries / drinks are bottomless so if you still manage to be hungry after your gigantic entree keep the refills coming! Their trademark spice container gives a good kick to your food too, I usually put it on my fries but not on the burger as much because I feel like it detracts from the true taste of the burger. Getting to their burgers, which is the main entree of Red Robin, they are absolutely delicious. Lots of varieties. You can also substitute Chicken or Turkey pattys for any of the burgers on the menu. My favorite part of the burgers is that they have less of a commercialized, chain restaurant feel (even though this is a chain restaurant) and more of a fresh off the grill taste, as if you were getting a burger at a diner or a burger joint. Instead of steak fries, you can substitute for their other sides such as mac and cheese. If you get the fries, be sure to try some of the sauces they may have in the kitchen if you are interested (I usually get a side of campfire sauce when I order fries, delicious!). Also try their freckled lemonade, its delicious and also bottomless. Or their giant tower of onion rings. It is way too early for me to review on the service of this location, mostly because it has just opened a few days ago. But based on my first experience here, I highly recommend trying it out and I will sure be back!
